result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: per order dated April 7, 2016, Appeal 2015AP1195CRLV, Within five business days the clerk of circuit court shall determine whether the October 10, 2014 transcript is in the circuit court file and, if so, thke the necessary steps to make it part of the circuit court record and then submit it to the clerk of the court of appeals by supplemental return. If the trancript has not been proveeded to the circuit court, the clerk of circuit court shall advise this court in writing.

Original Transcript 37 pages) commencing Court Trial 8.18.14 received and filed.
Court of Appeals order dated November 24, 2014, Appeal 2014XX1543CR, cases 14CF4520 and 14CF90, the court will take no action on the document that Berry filed pro-se on November 21, 2014.mg

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court vacates the finding of guilt entered to Count 3 on 8/18/2014 at the conclusion of the Court Trial; Judgment of Conviction entered on 8/18/2014 regarding Count 3, vacated. 
Court dismisses the case with prejudice. 

State and Defense heard as to issuing of new charges. Court notes the State has 72 hours to file a new case as the Court finds there is probable cause of determination that the Defendant committed a crime. Upon filing new case, court orders a $5,000 cash bail with TURN OVER to Justice Point with GPS monitoring.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms or firearm ammunition. No drug paraphernalia for personal use, delivery, distribution, or manufacturing. No possession of cocaine or marijuana. Defendant may not possess cash in an amount greater than $200.00 at any one time.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant's Memorandum of Law-Double Jeopardy, received and filed.
from Assistant District Attorney Karl Hayes with attachments, received and filed.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders case adjourned for the reasons placed on the record for a Hearing on 10-10-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
with attachments, from Assistant District Attorney Karl Hayes, received and filed.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Joshua Java Berry not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For the reasons placed on the record Court orders case adjourned for Hearing on 9-10-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from Assistant District Attorney Karl Hayes with attachments, received and filed.
Transcript from the Plea and Sentencing Hearing in case 04CF205 dated 7-20-2004, received and filed.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Scheduling. 
Court states it is not able to proceed without reviewing the transcripts from previous cases, including 04CF205. 
Defense motions Court to modify bail. Court addresses bail. Arguments heard. Court denies the defense motion to modify bail, bail/bond is to remain. 
Court orders case scheduled for Scheduling Hearing on 9-5-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Case scheduled for Sentencing. Due to the court's calendar the case will be adjourned for Sentencing. Case is adjourned for Sentencing 8/22/2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br.17.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Trial proceeded.  State produces Ex. 5, Stipulation, approved by Court, received. Ex. 1, Springfield .45 Pistol; Ex. 2, Florida CCW card; Ex. 3 5-page document printed from WI DOJ website; Ex. 4, Excerpt from Wis. Admin Code of Jus. 17.13; Ex. 6, Unfired .45 cal bullets, offered by the State, received. 
State rests subject to rebuttal. 
Sworn for defense: Joshua Berry.  Defense rests. Closing arguments by state and defense.  
Court finds Defendant guilty as charged in Count 3. 
Court passes the case to the afternoon for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing hearing. Court is in receipt of Waiver for Jury Trial. Court reviews the Waiver of Trial By Jury with the Defendant. Court approves the Waiver of Trial By Jury. Court orders case adjourned for Court Trial, Br. 17.  Court trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Scott F. Anderson in court, defendant Joshua Java Berry not in court, in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
At the request of the Defense, Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing, Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of MOTION HEARING  commencing  MAY 8, 2014 received and filed. (151 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to PD'S OFFICE.
Appeal 2014AP1289CR (appeal is dismissed for lack of jurisdiction) per opinion order dated June 19, 2014.mg

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sargent informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present in court is attorney Amber Rumpf and the co-defendant Christopher Joel Berry. Sworn for the State: 1). Officer Martez Ball (MPD).  Exhibit 1 (Diagram) offered, marked, and received into evidence.  Cross-Examination by Defense, Stephen A. Sargent, and attorney Amber Rumpf. Defendant, Joshua Java Berry waived his right to testify. Closing arguments made by the State and Defense, Stephen A. Sargent. Court DENIED the Motion to Suppress Evidence. Defense, Stephen A. Sargent requesting a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel waives the appearance of the defendant for today's proceedings.  State was prepared to commence the Preliminary Hearing today.  Both parties agree to an adjournment so that an officer be present to testify at the next scheduled court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant Christopher B, and Mariana H

Defendant Joshua Java Berry in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Joshua Java Berry in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
